data.title: Zscaler beats Q4 expectations, stock drops despite positive report. Red Canary contributes $114 million ARR. Revenue guidance $834-836 million.
data.description: Zscaler Inc's (NASDAQ: ZS) shares experienced a significant decline during early trading on Friday, despite the positive fiscal second-quarter report. Analyst insights showcased varying sentiments, with JMP Securities' analyst, Trevor Walsh, maintaining a Market Outperform rating but adjusting the price target from $355 to $290. Similarly, Rosenblatt Securities' analyst, Catharine Trebnick, kept a Buy rating but reduced the price target from $280 to $250. Concerns among investors persist regarding the company's "inorganic contribution," as highlighted by Walsh. Excluding Red Canary's ARR of $114 million, Zscaler's net-new ARR saw a 7% year-on-year increase to $139 million. The management provided guidance for revenue in the range of $834 million to $836 million. For more insights, refer to other analyst stock ratings.

data.title: SINBON and Swobbee collaborate to expand battery swapping in NYC to reduce fire risks and enhance last-mile mobility.
data.description: In New York City, SINBON and Swobbee are working together to enhance the implementation of a citywide battery swapping network. The primary goal is to decrease the fire hazards linked to charging e-bikes while promoting cleaner and dependable last-mile transportation. This initiative is crucial in a bustling city like New York, where safety and sustainability are paramount. The companies are focusing on expanding this network to improve the infrastructure for e-bike users.

data.title: Steven Spina promoted to Chief Underwriting Officer at TDC Specialty Underwriters, a leading E&S lines specialist.
data.description: In Unionville, Connecticut on February 27, 2026, TDC Specialty Underwriters, a prominent Excess & Surplus (E&S) lines expert under TDC Group, revealed the advancement of Steven Spina to Chief Underwriting Officer. Formerly the Executive Vice President, he now takes over the new role, showcasing the company's strategic shift.

data.title: AviaGames to discuss real-money mobile gaming at GDC Festival, celebrating 10th anniversary in 2026 with improved player payments and tech partnerships. Attendees to learn about Avia's competitive casual games.
data.description: In San Francisco, AviaGames, a prominent player in casual, skill-based games, is set to present at the 2026 GDC Festival of Gaming. They will delve into their 10th anniversary achievements, plans for 2026, enhanced player payment systems, and future collaborations with tech giants. Attendees can expect insights into Avia's competitive casual game lineup and platform that emphasizes player trust. Avia will host two panel discussions, one featuring PayPal, to discuss advancements. This event offers a glimpse into Avia's growth and strategies for the future.

data.title: AOC Pharma S.à r.l. discloses transparency notification, revealing key details.
data.description: Authorities have reported a new record of daily COVID-19 cases in the country, with 10,362 new infections confirmed in the past 24 hours. The total number of active cases has reached 87,419, with 532 patients in critical condition. Unfortunately, 76 new deaths have been recorded, bringing the total death toll to 1,258. The government has reminded citizens to follow health guidelines strictly to help curb the spread of the virus.

data.title: Vallarta Supermarkets to offer Western Union money services at all stores from Feb 28, 2026, expanding access for customers.
data.description: Starting February 28th, a well-known supermarket chain will provide access to affordable and trustworthy money transfer services in Santa Clarita, California. Customers of Vallarta Supermarkets will have the opportunity to utilize Western Union's money transfer services at all locations. This initiative aims to offer convenient financial solutions to customers, enhancing their shopping experience. This service expansion signifies the company's commitment to meeting the financial needs of its patrons.

data.title: Utz Brands to showcase new snacks at Natural Products Expo West, including Boulder Canyon products, Hall A, Booth 1117
data.description: Utz Brands, Inc., a prominent U.S. producer of branded salty snack foods, is set to unveil fresh innovative items from both Boulder Canyon® and Utz® at Booth 1117 in Hall A during the 2026 Natural Products Expo West happening at the Anaheim Convention Center in Anaheim, CA from March 4-6. Boulder Canyon, recognized as America's fastest-growing salty snack brand with a leading position as the top salty brand in the natural channel, will present its complete range of products, featuring classic kettle style snacks.

data.title: SEGG Media highlights Veloce's $61 million majority acquisition, expecting over $20 million revenue from it in 2026.
data.description: The acquisition is anticipated to generate more than $20 million in revenue in the year 2026.

data.title: Societe Generale reports number of shares and voting rights as of 23 Feb 2026 in regulated information.
data.description: On 23rd February 2026, the current share capital of the company is represented by a total of shares. This composition further corresponds to the total number of voting rights available within the organization. This information is disclosed as regulated data and is relevant for stakeholders and investors.

data.title: UCP accused of mismanagement in Alberta budget: 6x royalty revenue, tax hikes, deficits, service cuts. CUPE demands new approach.
data.description: In Edmonton, the UCP government has increased royalties, resulting in nearly six times higher revenue compared to the previous administration. Despite this, they are implementing tax hikes, deficits, and service cuts. CUPE Alberta President Raj Uppal criticizes the UCP's approach, stating that over the past six years, corporate taxes were slashed, education and healthcare were underfunded, and funding for post-secondary and municipalities was cut. The recent budget reveals a significant deficit, tax raises, and unresolved issues in governmental funding.

data.title: NextNav Inc. (NASDAQ:NN) appoints Lisa Hook to its Board of Directors, effective Feb. 24, 2026. She will also become Lead Independent Director.
data.description: NextNav Inc. (NASDAQ: NN), a key player in advanced terrestrial Positioning, Navigation, and Timing (PNT) and 3D geolocation solutions, has named Lisa Hook to its Board of Directors, starting from February 24, 2026. Ms. Hook will take on the role of Lead Independent Director and join the Company’s Technology and National Defense as well as Compensation and Human Capital Committees. The appointment marks an important development for NextNav Inc. as it continues to strengthen its leadership team to drive growth and innovation in the industry.

data.title: California American Water invests over $200 million in 2025 for statewide infrastructure upgrades, prioritizing system reliability and water quality for customers.
data.description: Enhancing System Dependability and Water Purity for Consumers In San Diego on February 27, 2026, California American Water disclosed its investment summary for 2025 focusing on enhancing system reliability and water quality. The total investment surpassed $200 million, allocated towards upgrading water and wastewater systems across the region.

data.title: Trump Media plans to separate Truth Social, a money-losing social media platform, amid merger talks with a fusion power company.
data.description: As part of its strategic plan, the company is planning to separate its unprofitable social media platform. This decision comes as the company aims to merge with a fusion power corporation. The separated social media platform has been incurring losses. The company believes that this move will better position them for the upcoming merger.

data.title: InventHelp client unveils new MTK-103 system for overspray containment, developed by a construction worker from Alabama.
data.description: In Pittsburgh on February 27, 2026, an inventor from Prattville, Alabama, shared his inspiration for creating a new folding device. This device aims to provide a better solution for controlling overspray from airless paint sprayers commonly used in interior painting projects. The inventor expressed his motivation to innovate in the construction industry and introduced the device under the name CHAMPION'S.
